page.title: 11THE NEW A41 BYPASS
page.content: The A 41 at Boxmoor has had traffic jams for years as people drive to work each day, and most think that a bypass is needed. The agreed route, however, is difficult to justify and will affect the people of Hemel by using land on Boxmoor and Roughdown Commons by coming down into the valley where more people can hear and see it. By affecting more residential property it will be dearer to build and it will have to be carried over marshy land. The Inspector's Report lists many pointsfor and against it."Preservation of Investment" means that commercial needs are important and two holes of the Council Golf Course were thought to be more of a loss than Roughdown Common, a registered S.S.I with 25 kinds of trees and a specialised chalk flora. It seems a pity that Common rights and ecology will be sacrificed.
